metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5130 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When packets with a mismatched RTP payload type are sent in WebRTC connections, in some circumstances a potentially exploitable crash is triggered. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.7 and Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
